;
;;方济各教皇。
;

;方济各教皇建议有办法祝福同性婚姻，回应五位保守派红衣主教，他们要求他在 LGBTQ+ 天主教徒列入议程的大型会议之前确认教会关于同性恋的教义。

;

;梵蒂冈周一公布了方济各 7 月 11 日写给红衣主教的一封信一天前收到他们提出的五个问题清单，或“疑虑”。方济各在信中建议，如果不将祝福与圣礼婚姻混淆，就可以对此类祝福进行研究。

;

;倡导 LGBTQ+ 天主教徒的新方式事工表示，这封信“显着推进”了 LGBTQ+ 的努力天主教徒受到教堂的欢迎，成为他们被边缘化的“压垮骆驼背上的一根稻草”。

;

;梵蒂冈认为婚姻是男人和女人之间牢不可破的结合。因此，长期以来一直反对同性婚姻。但方济各表示支持;民法将法律福利延伸至欧洲部分地区的同性配偶和天主教神父一直在祝福同性婚姻，而没有梵蒂冈的谴责。

;

;然而，方济各对枢机主教的回应标志着梵蒂冈当前立场的逆转官方立场。在 2021 年的解释性说明中，信仰教义部 ;说教会不能祝福同性恋工会;，因为“上帝不能祝福罪恶”。

;
;

;;相关：;;教皇斥责美国“落后”的保守派用意识形态取代信仰;;

;

;方济各在新信中重申，婚姻是男人和女人之间的结合。但在回答红衣主教们关于同性恋结合和祝福的问题时，他表示“教牧慈善”需要耐心和理解，神父不能成为“只会否认、拒绝和排斥”的法官。

;

;“为此理性地，牧师的审慎必须充分辨别是否有一个或多个人所要求的某种形式的祝福，不会传递错误的婚姻观念，”他写道。 “因为当请求祝福时，这是表达对上帝的帮助的请求，是对能够生活得更好的请求，是对能够帮助我们生活得更好的父亲的信任。”

;

;他说客观上有些情况“在道德上不可接受”，但同样的“教牧慈善”要求人们被视为罪人，他们的情况可能不完全有过错。

;

;方济各补充说，没有必要设立教区或教区。主教会议将这种教牧慈善变成固定的规范或协议，并表示这个问题可以根据具体情况来处理，“因为教会的生活是在超出规范的渠道上运行的”。

;

;新路事工执行主任弗朗西斯·德贝尔纳多 (Francis DeBernardo) 对教宗的开放态度表示欢迎。

;

;“允许牧师祝福同性伴侣，这意味着教会确实承认同性之间可以存在神圣的爱。夫妇，这些夫妇的爱反映了上帝的爱，”德伯纳多在一份声明中说。 “这些认可虽然不完全是 LGBTQ+ 天主教徒所希望的，但却是迈向更充分、更全面的平等的巨大进步。”

;

;五位枢机主教，全都是来自欧洲、亚洲、非洲和美洲的保守派主教，在信中向方济各提出挑战，要求他确认教会关于同性恋者、妇女任命、教皇权威和其他问题的教义。

;

;他们在为期三周的重要宗教会议开始前两天发布了这些材料。在梵蒂冈，LGBTQ+天主教徒及其在教会中的地位被提上议程。

;

;签署者是方济各最直言不讳的批评者，他们都退休了，属于由方济各任命的更教条主义的一代红衣主教。圣约翰·保罗二世或教皇本笃十六世。

;

;他们是德国的沃尔特·布兰德米勒 (Walter Brandmueller)，前梵蒂冈历史学家；美国的雷蒙德·伯克 (Raymond Burke)，;方济各解除了他的领导人职务梵蒂冈最高法院;；墨西哥的胡安·桑多瓦尔 (Juan Sandoval)，瓜达拉哈拉退休大主教；几内亚的罗伯特·萨拉 (Robert Sarah)，梵蒂冈礼拜仪式办公室的退休负责人；以及香港退休大主教陈日君。

;

;布兰德米勒和伯克是 2016 年方济各上一轮;怀疑;的四位签署人之一，此前他;允许离婚和民事再婚夫妇接受圣餐的争议性开放;。然后，红衣主教们担心方济各的立场违反了教会关于婚姻不可解除的教义。弗朗西斯从未回答他们的问题，他们的两名共同签署人随后去世。

;

;弗朗西斯这次确实做出了回应。红衣主教们没有公布他的答复，但显然觉得他的答复非常不令人满意，因此他们重新提出了五个问题，再次提交给他，并要求他简单地回答是或否。当他没有这样做时，红衣主教们决定公开这些文本，并向信徒发出“通知”警告。

;

;梵蒂冈教义办公室在几个小时后公布了他对他们的答复，尽管它没有这样做他在介绍中敦促红衣主教们不要害怕这次会议。

; Tue, 03 Oct 2023 11:52:01 +0800 Birkenstock set to float on stock market with valuation of nearly $10bnhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/03/birkenstock-stock-exchange-goes-public-share-price
;;2023-10-03T01:57:29Z;
;
;;一双勃肯凉鞋
;

;勃肯，复兴的德国凉鞋制造商，曾经深受医护人员的喜爱本月在股票市场上市时，其估值将高达 92 亿欧元（97 亿美元）。

;

;首次在纽约证券交易所发行约 3220 万股普通股公开发行。周一，该公司将其股票定价为每股 44 至 49 美元，这可能会使该公司筹集至多 15.8 亿美元。

;

;这个德国品牌在过去两年中有所复苏，现在深受名人和影响者的喜爱，粉丝包括肯德尔·詹纳 (Kendall Jenner)、吉吉·哈迪德 (Gigi Hadid) 和西耶娜·米勒 (Sienna Miller)。其中一个品牌出现在芭比娃娃电影中，玛格特·罗比 (Margot Robbie) 穿着一双粉色勃肯鞋 (Birkenstock)。去年，他们是;英国的之一最常购买的时尚单​​品;。

;
;

;;相关：;;“你必须以数据为导向”：时尚预测者使用人工智能来预测下一个趋势;

;
;

;根据行业报告，股票发行将于 10 月 11 日进行，这标志着这家成立于 1774 年的矫形鞋制造公司的一个里程碑。到 1897 年，康拉德·勃肯 (Konrad Birkenstock) 制造出了第一款适合脚部轮廓的灵活鞋底。

;

;公司一直由创始人家族掌控，直到 2021 年;将多数股权出售给私募股权集团 L Catterton; 以及法国奢侈品巨头伯纳德·阿尔诺 (Bernard Arnault) 的家族控股基金。

;

;但是，宽带子、软木和乳胶鞋底的凉鞋早在这之前就开始获得国际赞誉。

;

;在 20 世纪 60 年代的美国，这种凉鞋很快就被嬉皮士所采用，他们追求朴素的舒适感，并声称其实用的外观是反时尚的标志。

;

;但那是在超模凯特·莫斯 (Kate Moss) 穿上它们的时候。在 20 世纪 90 年代的一次时装拍摄中，这款凉鞋被推崇为一线明星的标准鞋履。

;

;从 Paco Rabanne、Valentino 到 Celine，品牌都定制了自己的 Birkenstock 版本，甚至将它们放在秀场上。

;

; p>;

;2019 年 2 月，女演员弗兰西斯·麦克多蒙德 (Frances McDormand) 穿着一双黄色鞋子登上奥斯卡颁奖典礼的舞台，证明了鞋履不一定要痛苦才能魅力四射的理念。

;

;财务主管苏珊娜·斯特里特 (Susannah Streeter)投资公司 Hargreaves Lansdown 的市场分析师表示：“时尚达人可能变化无常，虽然勃肯 (Birkenstock) 目前可能正沐浴在流行的光芒中，但它必须快速奔跑才能跟上时尚的步伐。假冒商品还可能导致公司在快速变化的时尚环境中失去立足点。”

;

;今年截至 6 月 30 日的 9 个月中，Birkenstock 的收入为 11.1 亿欧元（11.7 亿美元），同比增长较去年同期增长 21%。前 9 个月的净利润为 1.291 亿欧元，比一年前的 1.033 亿欧元下降了 20%。

;

;Birkenstock 表示，虽然其他公司已将生产转移到劳动力普遍更便宜的地方，例如亚洲其 95% 的产品在德国组装。

;

;该公司总部位于西部城市莱茵河畔林茨，在德国拥有多个制造基地，在全球拥有约 6,200 名员工。

;

;勃肯股票将在纽约证券交易所上市，股票代码为“BIRK”，该公司还透露了亿万富翁 LVMH 董事长伯纳德·阿尔诺 (Bernard Arnault) 之子亚历山大·阿尔诺 (Alexandre Arnault) 的董事会提名。

;

; Tue, 03 Oct 2023 10:22:01 +0800 US government issues first-ever space debris penalty to Dish Networkhttps://www.theguardian.com/science/2023/oct/02/fcc-space-debris-fine-dish-network-satellite
;;2023-10-03T01:27:18Z;
;
;;由澳大利亚光电系统 (EOS) 航空航天公司创建的文件讲义插图图像显示了从地球静止轨道上看到的地球视图描绘成群的太空碎片的高度。
;

;美国联邦通信委员会 (FCC) 向一家违反反太空碎片规则的公司开出了第一张罚单，;委员会周一宣布;。

;

;Dish Network 因未能使其 EchoStar 脱离轨道而必须向委员会支付 150,000 美元-七号卫星已经在太空运行了二十多年。 Dish 没有让卫星正确离轨，而是将其送入“处置轨道”，其高度足够低，足以造成轨道碎片风险。

;
;

;;相关：;;天文学家对巨大光污染发出警报新卫星;

;
;

;“随着卫星运营变得更加普遍，太空经济加速发展，我们必须确保运营商遵守他们的承诺，”执法局局长 Loyaan A Egal 说道。在宣布 Dish 和解的声明中。 “这是一项突破性的解决方案，清楚地表明 FCC 拥有强大的执法权力和能力来执行其极其重要的空间碎片规则。”

;

;2002 年，Dish 将卫星发射到地球静止轨道 - 一个太空领域始于距地球 22,000 英里（36,000 公里）处。它于 2012 年同意了一项轨道碎片减缓计划，该计划在完成任务后，将把 EchoStar-7 186 英里（300 公里）送入其驻地上方的“墓地轨道”，在那里它不会造成任何危险。

;

;但在 2022 年，Dish 意识到卫星的推进剂不足，不足以将卫星发送到预定目的地。相反，卫星最终仅位于活动地球静止轨道区域上方 76 英里（122 公里）处，偏离目标 178 公里。

;

;太空碎片，美国联邦通信委员会 (FCC) 将其广泛定义为无法正常运行的绕地球运行的人造物体航天器，一直是 FCC 日益关注的问题。他们表示，留在轨道上的旧材料越多，即将到来的卫星启动和完成新任务就越困难。 2022 年，他们通过了一项规则，要求卫星运营商在任务完成后五年内处置其卫星。

;

;“目前上空有数千吨轨道碎片 - 并且它将会增长，”FCC 主席 Jessica Rosenworcel 在 2022 年发布该规则的声明中表示。 “我们需要解决这个问题。因为如果我们不这样做，这些太空垃圾可能会限制新的机会。”

; Tue, 03 Oct 2023 09:52:01 +0800 Brazil expels illegal settlers from Indigenous lands in Amazonhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/03/brazil-expels-non-indigenous-settlers-apyterewa-trincheira-bacaja-para
;;2023-10-03T00:25:43Z;
;
;;巴西原住民在最高法院维持对其祖先土地的保护后庆祝。
;

;巴西政府已开始将数千名非原住民从两个原住民领地上驱逐，此举将影响生活在亚马逊雨林中心的数千名居民。

;

;巴西情报机构 ABIN 在一份声明中表示，这一目标目标是将帕拉州的阿皮特雷瓦和特林凯拉巴卡贾土地归还给原住民。它没有说明对非原住民的驱逐是否完全是和平的。

;

;这些领土位于帕拉州的圣费利克斯杜辛古、阿尔塔米拉、阿纳普和参议员何塞·波菲里奥等市周围。巴西政府表示;最高法院;和其他法官已下令进行此次行动。

;
;

;;相关：;;“我们捍卫了我们的权利土地”：巴西原住民欢呼最高法院的胜利;

;
;

;原住民群体估计有超过 10,000 名非原住民生活在这两个领土内。 ABIN 表示，境内 51 个村庄居住着多达 2,500 名原住民。

;

;“原住民土地上陌生人的存在威胁着原住民 [人民] 的完整性，并造成其他损害，例如森林遭到破坏、该机构在声明中表示。报告补充说，该地区约有 1,600 个家庭非法居住，其中一些家庭从事养牛和金矿开采等非法活动。 “他们还破坏了原生植被。”

;

;根据官方数据，阿皮特雷瓦地区连续四年是巴西原住民土地中森林砍伐最多的地区。当地媒体获得并于 9 月份在社交媒体上分享的视频显示，数百名非原住民生活在帕拉卡纳土地深处的一个新建城镇中，那里有餐馆、酒吧和教堂。

; ;

;参与周一行动的其他当局包括巴西原住民部、环境保护机构 IBAMA、联邦警察和武装部队等等。在 2019 年至 2022 年前总统贾尔·博尔索纳罗 (Jair Bolsonaro) 的极右政府执政期间，其中几个机构的权力受到限制，几乎没有采取任何行动来保护土著人民的领土。

;

;巴西总统路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦 (Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva) 已开始重建环境保护机构，并为原住民创建了八个保护区。在他执政后不久，他的政府;驱逐了数千人来自罗赖马州北部大片亚诺马米原住民领土的金矿矿工;。

;
;

;;相关：;;巴西首位土著人民部长：“现在是世界审视我们生活方式的时候了”;

;
;

;州和联邦当局今年也将土地掠夺者逐出阿尔托里奥瓜马领土。他们威胁要强行驱逐那些未能离开的定居者，并承诺消除通道和不规则设施。几乎所有非法居民都自愿离开。

;

;近年来对这些领土的侵犯促使巴西最高法院周四驳回了由农民支持的旨在阻止土著群体扩张的诉讼，从而保障了土著土地权利。其领土要求的大小。

;

;在法院审理的案件中，圣卡塔琳娜州辩称，巴西宪法颁布之日——1988 年 10 月 5 日——应该是原住民拥有实际占用土地的最后期限或合法地为重新占领领土而战。巴西最高法院的 11 名法官中有 9 名驳回了这一论点，这一裁决具有全国性影响。

; Tue, 03 Oct 2023 08:52:02 +0800 Matt Gaetz introduces motion to oust Kevin McCarthy as House speakerhttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/02/matt-gaetz-remove-kevin-mccarthy-speaker-government-shutdown
;;2023-10-02T23:24:10Z;
;
;;凯文·麦卡锡被记者包围
;

;国会议员马特·盖茨，佛罗里达州极右翼共和党人，周一提出了一项罢免众议院议长凯文·麦卡锡 (Kevin McCarthy) 众议院议长职务的动议，对这位共和党领导人成功避免本周末政府关门的努力表示愤怒。

;

;这一消息是在众议院通过一项临时支出法案两天后宣布的。将政府资助延长至 11 月 17 日，避免可能导致数十万联邦工作人员停薪的政府停工。在乔·拜登于周六晚签署该法案之前，众议院和参议院均以压倒性的两党多数通过了这项被称为持续决议的法案。

;
;

;;相关：; ;什么是“撤离动议”——驱逐程序议长麦卡锡？;

;
;

;但盖茨警告说，如果议长与民主党合作保持政府开放，他将采取行动罢免麦卡锡，他在周一晚上兑现了这一威胁。既然盖茨已经提出了一项腾出主席的动议，众议院领导层必须在两个立法日内就此事进行投票。

;

;麦卡锡的盟友预计会采取一些程序性策略来阻止盖茨的动议，但是如果这些努力失败，只需要在场投票成员的简单多数即可罢免议长。

;

;由于众议院共和党拥有微弱多数，麦卡锡只能在他的会议中失去五票，但仍能保住席位。议长职位，假设每位众议院议员都参与投票。尽管数学计算很棘手，但麦卡锡最近几天仍采取了挑衅的语气，坚称他有足够的选票来保留他的木槌。

;

;“我会活下去，”麦卡锡周日告诉哥伦比亚广播公司新闻。 “就这样吧。来吧。让我们结束这一切，开始执政吧。”

;

;周一下午，盖茨在众议院演讲中预览了他的动议 ;指责;麦卡锡与拜登达成“秘密协议”，向乌克兰提供额外资金，这已成为强硬派人士愤怒的根源。正确的立法者。国会通过的权宜之计支出措施不包括向乌克兰提供额外资金，但拜登周六表示，他“完全希望议长能够信守对乌克兰人民的承诺”，并很快通过一项补充资金法案来解决这一遗漏问题。

;

;

;A 104-year-old Chicago woman is hoping to be certified as the oldest person to ever skydive after leaving her walker on the ground and making a tandem jump in northern Illinois.

;
;

;;Related: ;;US woman breaks Guinness World Record for longest female beard;

;
;

;“Age is just a number,” Dorothy Hoffner told a cheering crowd moments after touching the ground Sunday at Skydive Chicago in Ottawa, about 85 miles (140km) south-west of Chicago, the Chicago Tribune reported.

;

;The Guinness World Record for oldest skydiver was set in May 2022 by 103-year-old Linnéa Ingegärd Larsson from Sweden. But Skydive Chicago is working to have Guinness World Records certify Hoffner's jump as a record, WLS-TV reported.

; ;

;Hoffner first skydived when she was 100. On Sunday, she left her walker behind just short of the plane –– a Skyvan –– and was helped up the steps to join the others waiting inside to skydive.

;

;“Let's go, let's go, Geronimo!” Hoffner said after she was finally seated.

;

;When she first skydived, she said she had to be pushed out of the aircraft. But on Sunday, tethered to a US Parachute Association-certified instructor, Hoffner insisted on leading the jump from 13,500ft (4,100 meters).

;

;She looked calm and confident when the plane was aloft and its aft door opened to reveal tan crop fields far below, shortly before she shuffled toward the edge and leaped into the air. She tumbled out of the plane head first, completing a perfect forward roll in the sky, before flying stable in freefall with her belly facing the ground.

; ;

;The dive lasted seven minutes, including her parachute's slow descent to the ground. Coming in to land, the wind pushed Hoffner's white hair back – she clung to the harness over her narrow shoulders, picked up her legs and plopped softly onto the grassy landing area.

;

;Friends rushed in to share congratulations, while someone brought over Hoffner's red walker. She rose quickly and she was asked how it felt to be back on the ground.

; ;

;“Wonderful,” Hoffner said. “But it was wonderful up there. The whole thing was delightful, wonderful, couldn't have been better.”

;

;After her jump, Hoffner's mind quickly turned to the future and other challenges. The lifelong Chicago woman, who will turn 105 in December, said she might take a ride in a hot air balloon next.

;

;“I've never been in one of those,” she said.

;The former CEO of Abercrombie & Fitch has been accused of exploiting young men for sex at events he and his partner hosted in the US and around the world, according to a BBC investigation.

;

;Most of the men also allege that a middleman, who was hired by the fashion brand's former boss Mike Jeffries, sexually “auditioned” them by requesting or offering to perform oral sex on them, before the young men were introduced to him and his partner, Matthew Smith.

;As part of a two-year ;investigation for Panorama;, the BBC reporter Rianna Croxford spoke to eight men who described attending events between 2009 and 2015 that involved sex acts and were run for Jeffries, 79, and Smith, 60.

;

;Jeffries, who was once one of America's highest-paid CEOs, stepped down from A&F in 2014. Half the men recruited have alleged that they were initially misled about the nature of the events or were not told sex was expected. Others said they understood the events would involve sex, but not exactly what was expected of them.

;

;Some of the men alleged they were exploited or abused and several told the BBC the possibility of modelling contracts with A&F was raised before they met Jeffries and Smith.

;

;They also told the BBC that, at the events, Jeffries and Smith would engage in sexual activity with about four men or “direct” them to have sex with each other. Afterwards, the men said staff at the event handed them envelopes filled with thousands of dollars in cash. All except one said they felt harmed by the experience.

;

;Appearing on a Panorama special episode, ;The Abercrombie Guys: The Dark Side of Cool;, one of the young men, the former model Barrett Pall, told Croxford: “My feeling of being in that room was: an animal. I was not a human to any of these people. I was a body. I was being presented to someone, to do what they wanted with.

;

;“What happened to me changed my life – and not for the better,” he added, and appeared to break down on camera.

;

;Two former US prosecutors, Brad Edwards and Elizabeth Geddes, have called for an investigation to determine whether charges for sex trafficking should be brought, after independently reviewing the BBC's evidence.

;

;The men described the middleman they met as missing part of his nose, which he covered with a snakeskin patch. The BBC has identified him as James Jacobson.

;

;David Bradberry, then 23, said he was introduced to Jacobson by an agent who described him as the gatekeeper to “the owners” of A&F in 2010, but said there was no mention of sex.

;

;At their meeting, he said Jacobson suggested A&F's official photographer should take his picture. Then, Bradberry said: “Jim made it clear to me that unless I let him perform oral sex on me, that I would not be meeting with Abercrombie & Fitch or Mike Jeffries.”

;

;“I was paralysed,” he said. “It was like he was selling fame. And the price was compliance.”

;

;Jacobson said in a statement through his lawyer that he took offence at the suggestion of “any coercive, deceptive or forceful behaviour on my part” and had “no knowledge of any such conduct by others”.

;

;The 70-year-old said he did not recall making promises of modelling opportunities.

;

;“Any encounter I had was fully consensual,” he said. “Everyone I came into contact with who attended these events went in with their eyes wide open.”

;

;Jeffries and Smith did not respond to repeated requests to comment on the allegations by the BBC and did not immediately respond to the Guardian's request to comment.

;

;A&F, which considers Jeffries its modern-day founder, told the BBC it was “appalled and disgusted” by his alleged behaviour. ;The Guardian understands, however, that Johnson has told the inquiry that he has been unable to access messages between 31 January and 7 June 2020, significant dates in the first wave of the pandemic during which thousands of people died, despite the phone being in action until the following spring.

;

;In the former prime minister's witness statement, he suggests that other leading players in the government at the time – which could include Sunak, Michael Gove and Matt Hancock – could hand over their phones with WhatsApp or Signal messages on them instead. ;Matt Fowler, co-founder of Covid-19 Bereaved Families for Justice, said: “If Johnson and Sunak don't provide the inquiry with the messages it has asked for, they need to face the full force of the law.

;

;The Cabinet Office brought a legal challenge against the inquiry's demand, arguing the request was too broad. Its lawyers said the messages contained some references to personal information and comments about identifiable government figures.

;

;Johnson, who had said when announcing the inquiry in 2021 that it must be “free to scrutinise every document”, opposed the case. He handed over his unredacted WhatsApp messages from May 2021 onwards to the inquiry, and said he would pass on all the messages before that point once he could get them off his phone.

;

;After the high court ruling, the government said it would comply with the decision to hand over all relevant communications.

;

;In his witness statement, Sunak, who is expected be the final witness in the second stage of the inquiry, said: “Having changed my phone a number of times over the last three years, I do not have access to the WhatsApp messages that I sent or received during the relevant time, and neither were the messages backed up.

;

;“My expectation would be that if the officials on those groups had considered that any information being communicated by WhatsApp message needed to be preserved to form part of the official HMT record, then those officials would have taken steps to ensure that happened.”

;

;In his own statement, Johnson, who is due to give two days of evidence in December, said: “With the assistance of a technical team, we have been able to retrieve messages from the old phone. There is a period for which messages were not retrievable (from 31 January to 7 June 2020 inclusive). The technical team has been unable to determine the cause of this.

;

;“I do, however, anticipate that the content of the messages I cannot access should be held by others and I would happily consider them further if they can be provided.”

;

;A spokesperson for Johnson pointed to the witness statement and said the former prime minister would continue to cooperate fully with the inquiry.

;

;A government spokesperson said: “The government established the Covid inquiry to transparently establish the facts and we have submitted more than 55,000 documents in support of their work. To ensure the integrity of the inquiry is not undermined it is vital that any evidence submitted is heard in context and in full and so we will not be commenting on leaks.

;

;“We are concerned that selective sections of evidence appear to have been handed to the media and all possible steps should be taken to guard against further leaks.”
